intro: Paris taitungensis, commonly known as the Taitung paris, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Parisaceae and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three broad, lance-shaped leaflets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
